meanings.def: before now or before a particular time in the past
examples: We got there early but Mike had already left.
By 2015, filming of the sequel was already under way.
Much of what he said I knew already.
I already knew this because Mike had told me.
(British English) I’ve just had some bad news.
(North American English) I just got some bad news.

meanings.def: used to express surprise that something has happened so soon or so early
examples: You're not leaving already, are you?

meanings.def: used to emphasize that a situation or problem exists
examples: The new company already has an excellent reputation.
There are far too many people already. We can't take any more.

meanings.def: used after a word or phrase to show that you are annoyed
examples: Just stop already, no one feels sorry for you.

meanings.def: used to say that something is annoying or boring and that you want it to stop

idioms.def: used to say that something is annoying or boring and that you want it to stop
